ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
1= Heterosexual, 2= Gay or lesbian, 3= Bisexual or pansexual, 4= Asexual, 5= Not sure, 6= Other, 99= Unknown or not reported

ElementDescription: If you selected 'other' for sexual orientation, please describe.
Which of the following best describes your feelings of sexual attraction to women?
Notes: 1 = Very sexually attracted; 2 = A good deal sexually attracted; 3 = Somewhat sexually attracted; 4 = A little sexually attracted; 5 = Not at all sexually attracted

ElementDescription: Which of the following best describes your feelings of sexual attraction to men?
Notes: 1 = Very sexually attracted; 2 = A good deal sexually attracted; 3 = Somewhat sexually attracted; 4 = A little sexually attracted; 5 = Not at all sexually attracted

ElementDescription: In the past 5 years, who have you had sex with? (We use the word 'sex' to mean any kind of sexual contact with another person, including sexual intercourse, oral sex, and non-penetrative sex.)
Notes: 1 = Men only; 2 = Women only; 3 = Both men and women; 4 = I have not had sex

ElementDescription: What is your current marital status?
Notes: 1= Married; 2= Separated; 3= Divorced; 4= Widowed; 5= Never Married

ElementDescription: Which of the following best describes your current relationship situation?
Notes: 1 = Living with someone in a marriage-like relationship or engaged to be married; 2 = Steadily dating one person, but not engaged; 3 = Dating one or more people, but not in a steady relationship; 4 = Not currently dating
